title: Teenager who murdered solicitor with screwdriver 'should have been in jail'
text:

A teenager who murdered a solicitor with a screwdriver should have been in jail when it happened, says a previous victim.

The girl, 17, said that Ewan Ireland, 18, threw liquid at her – which she said was ammonia – in December, near where he killed dad-of-two Peter Duncan.

Ireland admitted the earlier attack at North Tyneside magistrates court in March. It happened near Eldon Square shopping centre, Newcastle, where Peter was killed on August 14.

Ireland was sentenced to a conditional discharge.

His female victim said in a post on social media: “The lad who stabbed that man is the same lad who threw ammonia in my face.

(Image: North News)

“They had clear CCTV and I was in hospital with a burn on my eye. He got 12 months on licence, maybe if he got what he deserved then that man might not have lost his life.”

Ireland killed Peter, 52, – described by his family as a caring and devoted father loved by all who knew him – with a blow to the heart.

He took offence when his victim raised his arm to let him through some electric doors.

Ireland, once a promising Newcastle United footballer, pleaded guilty to murder, having an offensive weapon and theft of screwdrivers.

He will be sentenced in December.

(Image: PA)

He had 31 previous convictions and was on bail for affray at the time.

A CPS spokesman said: “We can only charge an offence that is supported by the evidence.

“In this case although a liquid was thrown in the victim’s face, there was no scientific evidence to identify the substance as ammonia.”
description: A previous victim of Ewan Ireland believes if he'd have got 'what he deserved' when he attacked her, then the latest victim might not have lost his life
